npvCalculator.explanationTitle: Detailed Explanation of Net Present Value
npvCalculator.explanationIntro: The core idea is that the value of money changes over time. 1000 EGP today has more purchasing power than 1000 EGP a year from now due to inflation and alternative investment opportunities (opportunity cost). The discount rate is our tool to measure this change.
npvCalculator.explanationScenario1: Scenario 1 (Profit): If you were to receive 1200 EGP after one year, its present value today (at a 10% discount rate) is only 1090.9 EGP (1200 / 1.10). Since you paid 1000 and received the equivalent of 1090.9, the NPV is +90.9. This means your investment is better than the alternative.
npvCalculator.explanationScenario2: Scenario 2 (Break-even): If you were to receive 1100 EGP after one year, its present value is 1000 EGP (1100 / 1.10). The NPV is 0. Your investment is good, but it doesn't outperform the alternative.
npvCalculator.explanationScenario3: Scenario 3 (Loss): If you were to receive 900 EGP after one year, its present value is only 818.1 EGP (900 / 1.10). The NPV is -181.9. You would be better off putting your money in the alternative investment.
npvCalculator.interpretationPositive: Positive Value: The investment is profitable and outperforms the alternative.
npvCalculator.interpretationZero: Zero Value: The investment is good, but does not outperform the alternative.
npvCalculator.interpretationNegative: Negative Value: The investment is unprofitable, and it is better to choose the alternative.
npvCalculator.npvResultTooltip: If the number is positive, the investment is profitable and outperforms your alternative. If it's negative, you might be better off putting your money elsewhere.
npvCalculator.breakEvenSalePriceTooltip: This is the sale price at the end of the term that would make the NPV zero. Selling for more than this makes the investment profitable according to your discount rate.

introductionPage.title: Tools Guide
introductionPage.description: Explore all available tools to help you make informed investment decisions. Click on any tool to learn more.

fullunit.whatItDoes: This is the most comprehensive tool. It gathers step-by-step data about a unit, including its price, payment plan, expected rental income, and growth rates. In the end, it provides you with an integrated report containing all important financial metrics (like ROI, ROE, Payback Period, etc.) to help you fully evaluate the opportunity.
fullunit.example: Instead of a simple numerical example, imagine you're entering data for a new apartment: a price of 2 million, a 20% down payment, quarterly installments, and an expected rent of 10,000/month. This tool will calculate everything for you and give you a clear final result on the investment's viability.

paymentplan.whatItDoes: This tool helps you create and visualize a detailed payment plan for any property. It is particularly useful for complex plans with uneven payments, such as large annual payments or variable installments.
paymentplan.example: A property priced at 2,000,000 EGP, with a 10% down payment, 10% on handover, and the rest over 40 quarterly installments. You can use the tool to specify that the first 4 installments are 50,000 EGP each, then distribute the remaining amount equally over the other 36 installments.

mortgage.whatItDoes: Calculates the details of a mortgage loan. Once you enter the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment period, it will calculate your monthly payment, the total interest you will pay, and the total amount you will have paid by the end of the loan term.
mortgage.example:
Formula (simplified): Monthly Payment = [Loan Amount √ó (Monthly Interest)] / [1 - (1 + Monthly Interest)^(-Number of Months)]

Example Data:
- Loan Amount: 1,500,000 EGP
- Annual Interest Rate: 8% (i.e., 0.667% monthly)
- Loan Term: 20 years (i.e., 240 months)

Result:
By applying the formula, you'll find the monthly payment is approximately 12,547 EGP.

savedunits.whatItDoes: This page allows you to view and manage all the real estate units you have previously analyzed and saved. From here, you can quickly access your analyses, update the deal status (e.g., from 'Under Consideration' to 'Purchased'), or delete units you are no longer interested in.

dashboard.whatItDoes: This is your control panel for comparing investments. You can select multiple units from your saved list and view a direct comparison between them based on key financial metrics (like ROI, payback period, etc.). This tool helps you make an informed decision when choosing between several opportunities.

portfolio.whatItDoes: Track the performance of your entire real estate portfolio. Add your purchased properties, record their income and expenses, and get a comprehensive overview of your net assets and returns. This tool is ideal for managing your current investments and evaluating their financial performance over time.

roi.whatItDoes: This tool measures the profitability of your investment relative to its total cost (purchase price + additional costs). It's a fundamental way to find out 'How much will my investment earn each year?' relative to all money paid, helping you compare different opportunities.
roi.example:
Formula: (Net Annual Profit / Total Investment Cost) √ó 100

Example Data:
- Purchase Price: 2,000,000 EGP
- Additional Costs (finishing): 200,000 EGP
- Annual Rent: 150,000 EGP
- Annual Expenses: 20,000 EGP

Calculation Steps:
1. Total Cost = 2,000,000 + 200,000 = 2,200,000 EGP
2. Net Profit = 150,000 - 20,000 = 130,000 EGP
3. Apply Formula = (130,000 / 2,200,000) √ó 100 = 5.91%

roe.whatItDoes: This tool focuses on the return from your own money only (equity), ignoring loan funds. It is an important metric for evaluating the efficiency of your personal capital and shows the profit generated from the funds you invested directly.
roe.example:
Formula: (Net Annual Cash Flow / Total Equity) √ó 100

Example Data:
- Total Equity (down payment + costs): 500,000 EGP
- Net Cash Flow (rent - expenses - loan payment): 40,000 EGP

Calculation Steps:
1. Apply Formula = (40,000 / 500,000) √ó 100 = 8%

caprate.whatItDoes: A quick metric to compare the attractiveness of different properties regardless of their financing method. It compares the property's annual net operating income to its price, giving you an idea of the potential return before financing costs.
caprate.example:
Formula: (Net Annual Operating Income / Property Price) √ó 100

Example Data:
- Property Price: 2,200,000 EGP
- Net Operating Income (rent - expenses, no loan): 130,000 EGP

Calculation Steps:
1. Apply Formula = (130,000 / 2,200,000) √ó 100 = 5.91%

payback.whatItDoes: This tool calculates the length of time it will take to recover the full amount you paid out of your own pocket (your initial investment) through net annual cash profits. The shorter the period, the better.
payback.example:
Formula: Total Initial Investment / Net Annual Cash Flow

Example Data:
- Initial Investment (down payment + costs): 550,000 EGP
- Net Annual Cash Flow: 40,000 EGP

Calculation Steps:
1. Apply Formula = 550,000 / 40,000 = 13.75 years.

appreciation.whatItDoes: Helps you project the future value of your property based on an assumed annual growth rate. This is useful for assessing long-term growth potential and knowing the future value of your asset.
appreciation.example:
Formula: Future Value = Current Price √ó (1 + Growth Rate)^Number of Years

Example Data:
- Current Price: 2,000,000 EGP
- Annual Growth Rate: 10%
- Number of Years: 5 years

Calculation Steps:
1. Apply Formula = 2,000,000 √ó (1 + 0.10)^5 = 3,221,020 EGP.

npv.whatItDoes: An advanced tool that evaluates the long-term viability of an investment. It considers the 'time value of money,' meaning a pound today is worth more than a pound in the future. If the result is positive, the investment is good.
npv.example:
Basic Concept: Are the future returns of an investment, when discounted to their present value, greater than the initial cost?

Example Data:
- Initial Cost: 550,000 EGP
- Net Annual Cash Flow: 40,000 EGP (for 10 years)
- Discount Rate (return on an alternative investment): 15%

Result:
The calculator discounts each annual cash flow (40,000) to its present value, sums them up, and then subtracts the initial cost. If the result is positive, the investment outperforms the alternative. If negative, the alternative investment is better.

welcome.title: Welcome to Belgeneh!
welcome.content: This is a quick tour to get you started. We'll walk through the key features to help you make smart investment decisions.

sidebar.title: Main Navigation
sidebar.content: This is the sidebar. From here, you can access all the tools and calculators you'll need.

introduction.title: Tools Guide
introduction.content: Learn about all the tools and how to use them to make better investment decisions.

fullUnit.title: Full Unit Calculator
fullUnit.content: This is our most powerful tool. Use it to perform a comprehensive analysis of any property, from installments to rent and profitability.

paymentPlan.title: Custom Payment Plan
paymentPlan.content: This tool helps you create and visualize a detailed payment plan for any property. It is particularly useful for complex plans with uneven payments, such as large annual payments or variable installments.

mortgage.title: Mortgage Calculator
mortgage.content: Calculates the details of a mortgage loan. Once you enter the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment period, it will calculate your monthly payment, the total interest you will pay, and the total amount you will have paid by the end of the loan term.

savedUnits.title: Saved Units
savedUnits.content: After analyzing a unit, you can save it here. This is where you'll find all the opportunities you're considering.

dashboard.title: Comparison Dashboard
dashboard.content: Torn between several units? Use this tool to compare your saved units side-by-side and make the best decision.

portfolio.title: Personal Portfolio
portfolio.content: Once you purchase a property, you can add it here to track its financial performance as part of your investment portfolio.

roi.title: Return on Investment (ROI)
roi.content: This tool measures the profitability of your investment relative to its total cost (purchase price + additional costs). It's a fundamental way to find out 'How much will my investment earn each year?' relative to all money paid, helping you compare different opportunities.

roe.title: Return on Equity (ROE)
roe.content: This tool focuses on the return from your own money only (equity), ignoring loan funds. It is an important metric for evaluating the efficiency of your personal capital and shows the profit generated from the funds you invested directly.

capRate.title: Capitalization Rate (Cap Rate)
capRate.content: A quick metric to compare the attractiveness of different properties regardless of their financing method. It compares the property's annual net operating income to its price, giving you an idea of the potential return before financing costs.

payback.title: Payback Period
payback.content: This tool calculates the length of time it will take to recover the full amount you paid out of your own pocket (your initial investment) through net annual cash profits. The shorter the period, the better.

appreciation.title: Asset Appreciation
appreciation.content: Helps you project the future value of your property based on an assumed annual growth rate. This is useful for assessing long-term growth potential and knowing the future value of your asset.

npv.title: Net Present Value (NPV)
npv.content: An advanced tool that evaluates the long-term viability of an investment. It considers the 'time value of money,' meaning a pound today is worth more than a pound in the future. If the result is positive, the investment is good.

finishTour.title: You're all set!
finishTour.content: You've learned the basics. Explore the tools and start making smarter investment decisions today. Good luck!
